p: These lineages are defined according to the amino acid divergence of the H protein between the different strains. Thus, it is considered that two given strains belong to a certain lineage when the protein H amino acid divergence is less than 3.5% [ 134]. On the other hand, following the guidelines based on MeV studies, sub-lineage strains present a minimum “bootstrap” value of 70% and at least 98% of aminoacidic identity [ 61].
